Change has been successfully merged
Also needed for BMC, Chassis, and Hypervisor in this repo? Or was this a host-only thing?
Yes. This would be needed for all of them. Once we settle on the direction, I will get those patches up.
Done
Does this commit relate to this issue https://discord.com/channels/775381525260664832/775381525260664836/1251022871258468432?
Yes! I am working on resolving the other units as well.
Could we change this MACRO to the configuration option and the `host-objpath` value should be removed?
Acknowledged

<did not mean to resolve>
Thanks for the hint, I see there are other state managers in the repo and they all have the same issue. Example, bmc_state_manager, chassis_state_manager, etc. They all have options in meson to configure the path. So, this commit by itself is incomplete, I should fix all those either in this commit or follow ups.

I see multiple options here:
(1) We could do a dirname(objPathInst) and that would reuse meson configuration all across the board.
(2) Convert all the meson configuration to provide just the name, for example,
```
    'host-objpath', type: 'string',
    value: '/xyz/openbmc_project/state/host',
```
Could be
```
    'host-objpath', type: 'string',
    value: 'host',
```
And the source would have a macro for '/xyz/openbmc_project/state' and we can infer objPathInst
```
auto objPathInst = std::string(HOST_STATE_OBJMGR_PATH) + "/" + std::string{HOST_OBJPATH} + std::to_string(hostId); 
```
I need to check how consistent this is across all the state managers.

Don't use Meson for this.  We need to get away from using it for these dbus configurations.


The phosphor-dbus-interfaces already defines the appropriate path to use here.

```
sdbusplus::server::xyz::openbmc_project::state::Host::namespace_path::value
```

This is probably the same thing as: `phosphor::state::manager::Host::namespace_path::value` ?
Even better. Thanks. I was wondering how it would even work if I compiled it with arbitrary paths

Worked through this and used properties from phosphor-dbus-interfaces instead of meson build objects. Checked that no machine in openbmc/openbmc is setting host-objpath, host-busname, so, it is safe to remove. If this is the direction we want to go in, I can probably split this patch up and work on the other interfaces in this repo, like chassis-state.
nit: I know we're just trying to copy paste here from the spec but no reason we can't just line wrap at 72 chars here to keep the commit message cleaner.
I was under the 80char impression. I will fix it up.
Done
A few nits, but generally all correct.
LGTM
Thanks for the fixes Amithash. I'll let you decide what you want to do with the remaining "nit" comments.
I split this up. Since there was a lot of changes unrelated to the actual change.
Using a dbus interface name as the base part of the service name isn't an intentional design point, but this is effectively what was already being done, so I think we can leave that as-is now.

nit (since this was already done this way):

It is better to use `sdbusplus::object_path(HostState::namespace_path) / (...::host + std::to_string(hostId))`.
Done. It goes into the previous diff.
nit: `operator/` on `object_path` could be used here too.
Done.

All of the commands below look good with this change, but this specific call still doesn't work with this change. Is it supposed to?

root@p10bmc:~# busctl call xyz.openbmc_project.State.Host \
> /xyz/openbmc_project/state/host0 org.freedesktop.DBus.ObjectManager \
> GetManagedObjects
Call failed: Unknown method GetManagedObjects or interface org.freedesktop.DBus.ObjectManager.
That's expected because the object manager isn't hosted there anymore.  You'd have to go up to `state` and then you should see it.
Acknowledged
Will give Matt a day to take a quick look then we can get this in.
looks good to me
